alert.note: Alert for Saline (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 9:33PM CST until March 06 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. While the heaviest rain has moved out of the flood warning area, it will take some time for any linger flooding to recede. * WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois, Southwest Indiana and western Kentucky, including the following areas, in southern Illinois, Gallatin, Hardin, Pope, Saline and White. In Southwest Indiana, Posey. In western Kentucky, Union. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 931 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall have moved across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Carmi, Morganfield, Shawneetown, Norris City, Rosiclare, Uniontown, Ridgway, New Harmony, Crossville, Enfield, Equality, Dixon Springs, New Haven, Elizabethtown, Omaha, Old Shawneetown, Maunie, Junction and Eddyville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
